Package oh_hecc.mvc

Class OhHeccNetworkFrame

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.mvc.OhHeccNetworkFrame
public class OhHeccNetworkFrame extends Object
This class holds the JFrame which holds the View object responsible for showing the Model to the user

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private JFrame
    theFrame
    The JFrame that shows theView (holding the View object) to the user
    private JComponent
    theView
    The View (as a JComponent) which this frame views

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OhHeccNetworkFrame()
    Constructs this object, albeit in the form of a frame, with the title 'OH-HECC!', that's invisible and contains nothing.
    OhHeccNetworkFrame​(JFrame f)
    A version of the constructor that uses a predefined JFrame instead (that it'll basically claim ownership of)
    OhHeccNetworkFrame​(JFrame f, JComponent v, ModelController mc)
    Constructor that utilizes an existing JFrame and View instead, and calls all the setup stuff.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addTheModelController​(ModelController mc)
    Adds the ModelController to the frame (as a keylistener to the frame, and as mouse(motion)listener(s) to its content pane)
    void
    addTheView​(JComponent viewToAdd)
    Adds theViewToAdd to TheFrame.
    (package private) void
    closeTheWindow()
    Literally just closes this window (frame is made invisible, and is promptly disposed of)
    (package private) void
    confirmWindowClose()
    Brings up a JOptionPane ConfirmDialog to ask the user if they're sure they want to quit Closes the window if the user confirms that they want to close the window.
    void
    finishSetup()
    Finishes setting up the frame.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • theFrame

      private final JFrame theFrame
      The JFrame that shows theView (holding the View object) to the user

    • theView

      private JComponent theView
      The View (as a JComponent) which this frame views

  • Constructor Details

    • OhHeccNetworkFrame

      public OhHeccNetworkFrame()
      Constructs this object, albeit in the form of a frame, with the title 'OH-HECC!', that's invisible and contains nothing.

      Yes, I know, it's *really* exciting.

    • OhHeccNetworkFrame

      public OhHeccNetworkFrame​(JFrame f)
      A version of the constructor that uses a predefined JFrame instead (that it'll basically claim ownership of)
      Parameters:
      f - a pre-declared JFrame that this object will basically claim ownership of.

    • OhHeccNetworkFrame

      public OhHeccNetworkFrame​(JFrame f, JComponent v, ModelController mc)
      Constructor that utilizes an existing JFrame and View instead, and calls all the setup stuff.
      Parameters:
      f - the existing JFrame, which this object will commandeer and put the View object into
      v - the existing View object to put into that JFrame.
      mc - the ModelController which has listeners that need to be added to the JFrame

  • Method Details

    • addTheView

      public void addTheView​(JComponent viewToAdd)
      Adds theViewToAdd to TheFrame. CENTER in TheFrame's content pane.
      Parameters:
      viewToAdd - the View object that's being added to theFrame

    • addTheModelController

      public void addTheModelController​(ModelController mc)
      Adds the ModelController to the frame (as a keylistener to the frame, and as mouse(motion)listener(s) to its content pane)
      Parameters:
      mc - the ModelController to be added

    • finishSetup

      public void finishSetup()
      Finishes setting up the frame. Makes it 800*600, requests focus, and invalidates it (so it gets repainted)

    • confirmWindowClose

      void confirmWindowClose()
      Brings up a JOptionPane ConfirmDialog to ask the user if they're sure they want to quit Closes the window if the user confirms that they want to close the window.

    • closeTheWindow

      void closeTheWindow()
      Literally just closes this window (frame is made invisible, and is promptly disposed of)
